p: The minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) has been carried out against the most inhibited pathogenic fungi using 96-well microplates (Nunc MaxiSorp®, Vedbaek, Denmark) by a micro-dilution method, as reported by Elshafie et al. [ 43, 44]. A 4 mL liquid suspension from fresh fungal cultures (96 h) was prepared at 10 8 spore/mL. The tested EO was dissolved in potato dextrose broth (PDB) at 800, 1000, 1200, 1400, and 1600 µL/mL according to the obtained results from the initial antifungal screening assay. Two hundred µL/well from each prepared concentration of EO and 100 µL/well of the prepared fungal suspension were added in the microplate and then incubated at 24 ± 2 °C. The absorbance was measured at λ = 450 nm using an Elisa microplate reader instrument (DAS s.r.l., Rome, Italy) after 48, 120, and 168 h. The whole experiment was repeated in triplicate.
